objects.x_mitre_detectable_by_common_defenses_ex: Easily determined and not intended to be protected information. Publicly collected and shared repositories of email addresses exist.
objects.name: Discover target logon/email address format
objects.description: Email addresses, logon credentials, and other forms of online identification typically share a common format. This makes guessing other credentials within the same domain easier. For example if a known email address is first.last@company.com it is likely that others in the company will have an email in the same format. (Citation: RSA-APTRecon)
objects.x_mitre_difficulty_for_adversary_explana: Scraping of known email addresses from the target will likely reveal the target standard for address/username format.  This information is easily discoverable.

external_references.description: Rotem Kerner. (2015, October). RECONNAISSANCE: A Walkthrough of the “APT” Intelligence Gathering Process. Retrieved March 1, 2017.
